content.question: Which of the following best explains changes in the federal government resulting from the Great Depression?

choices.label: Policymakers embraced a laissez-faire model, further withdrawing the federal government from participation in the economy.
Policymakers developed a limited welfare state to reduce the effects of mass unemployment and social upheavals.
Policymakers resisted the efforts of organized labor unions to improve conditions for workers.
Policymakers fostered fully cooperative relations between government and businesses.

content.answer: Policymakers developed a limited welfare state to reduce the effects of mass unemployment and social upheavals.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
